This was a proper retro gaming experience for me, loved it! Even today with it's old visuals and sounds it is a very fun experience and was worth every penny. One thing I will say is it's very difficult, even on easy difficulty, that may just be me but I have heard similar things from many of my friends so perhaps its just the way it is. Regardless, great game!

Incredibly immersive exploration and design. The love that Half-Life has garnered was easily recognisable from the opening sequence. Combat is accurate and timeless. My only letdown would have to be Dr Freeman's Quake-streamed rollerskating when it comes to timed manoeuvres, slippery rungs, and the odd finicky jumping puzzle. Saving often is advised. Despite the technology of the day, Half-Life remains a classic that has managed to retain a wholeness to its vision that few games achieve and which Half-Life 2 performed to even greater excellence.

I think going into this game knowing next to nothing about it is the best course of action. It was a great experience, plenty of good visual storytelling and next to no hand holding, which is a nice change of pace when comparing to today's video game titles. I can see why there are plenty of people hailing it as one of the greatest games ever. But if you go into this game fresh, having never played it before, with that level of expectation, I think you might be setting yourself up for disappointment. In my opinion it's a great game that held up well, especially for a 1998 game. A solid 12-16 hour experience worth every penny. 

This game made me want to try finishing Half-Life 2 next, and excluding the 4 hours I put in at the time of this review, the only thing I know about it is that people REALLY want Half-Life 3 for some reason, so I'm looking forward to seeing why.

After completing the game, I just have to say that it was absolutely fantastic. The story is amazing, the amount of content is amazing, the gameplay mechanics are amazing, I could go on and on. If you don't mind the old graphics and the length of the game (it's pretty long) than I'd say give it a shot, it's fantastic.

Despite a slow start, and rather unsatisfying (or even boring) ending, Half-Life is a great way to see where a lot of the fundamental tenants of modern fps design come from. Playing with its historical position in mind really opens you up to how revolutionary some of these gameplay elements (standard by today) would have been at the time. Despite being a historical document, the game is also merely very satisfying to play: level design rewards critical thinking and gunplay feels satisfying.

papu:v
A Classic That Everyone Should Play At Least Once

Look, set aside from the outstanding amount of mods made for this gem, you really have to just step back and look at how game changing this game really was. Valve made a character that everyone could imagine them selves to be, because you know a lot people work at factories and blue collar jobs, not all but a lot. It brought interesting weapon selection, lots of different enemies to fight and understand. It wasn't just a walk in the park, you had to think a little and figure each situation out. Most games before this didnt really put the time into the character developments and story to make you want to play it to the end. I played this game from the very beginning when it launched and to this very day I have never played a game that wowed me like this one did. Its in my top 3 best games of all time. 10/10 It really don't get much better than this.
still one of the best single player games out there.

A classic game, definitely a must play for almost anyone.
 It is very different from today's games, Half life doesn't guide you through the whole game. After the initial tutorial, the game is like "Here's a crowbar. Do ya thing." There were (embarrassingly many) instances where i had to look at walkthrough videos to find out what am I supposed to do. 
However I enjoyed the time I spent on this game and I think it's worth checking out.
